definitions: not conforming to accepted or established beliefs, standards, or practices
examples: His heterodox views on education challenged traditional teaching methods
The scientist proposed heterodox theories that contradicted mainstream physics

definitions: consisting of dissimilar or diverse elements, parts, or ingredients mixed together
examples: The class had a heterogeneous mix of students from various backgrounds
The rock sample showed heterogeneous mineral content throughout its structure

definitions: sexually attracted to people of the opposite sex rather than the same sex
examples: Most romantic films feature heterosexual couples as main characters
The survey asked participants to identify as heterosexual, homosexual, or bisexual

definitions: enabling someone to discover or learn something through experience and experimentation
examples: The teacher used heuristic methods to help students find answers independently
This heuristic approach to programming encourages creative problem solving

definitions: shaped or made by cutting or chopping with an ax or similar tool
examples: The cabin was built from roughly hewn logs
Ancient sculptures were hewn directly from solid rock

definitions: relating to or using the hexadecimal system of numerical notation
examples: The programmer converted the hex values to decimal numbers
Web designers often use hex codes to specify colors

definitions: relating to a numbering system that uses sixteen as its base
examples: Computer programmers frequently work with hexadecimal numbers
The color code was written in hexadecimal format

definitions: having a shape with six straight sides and six angles
examples: Honeycomb cells have a perfect hexagonal structure
The gazebo featured a hexagonal roof design

definitions: in a state of inactivity and metabolic depression during winter months
examples: The hibernating bears won't emerge until spring arrives
Scientists studied the hibernating animals' reduced heart rates

definitions: characteristic of rural people considered to be unsophisticated or provincial
examples: The city dwellers mocked his hick accent and mannerisms
She tried to hide her hick background at the university

definitions: so ugly or unpleasant as to be shocking or frightening to see
examples: The accident left a hideous scar across his face
The building's hideous architecture clashed with its historic surroundings

definitions: organized according to rank or authority in ascending series of levels
examples: The company maintained a strict hierarchical management structure
Medieval society was highly hierarchical with rigid class divisions

definitions: written in or consisting of picture symbols representing words or sounds
examples: Ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic writing covered the temple walls
His handwriting was so bad it looked hieroglyphic

definitions: dealing with or interested in serious intellectual or cultural matters
examples: The magazine featured highbrow articles about philosophy and art
She preferred highbrow entertainment like opera and classical music

definitions: situated above another in position, rank, or status
greater in amount, degree, or intensity than normal or average
examples: The eagle built its nest on higher ground
Students moved to higher levels after passing exams
Gas prices reached higher levels than last year
The fever indicated a higher infection rate

definitions: relating to or characteristic of mountainous regions or elevated land areas
examples: Highland cattle are adapted to harsh mountain climates
The highland villages remained isolated during winter months

definitions: causing great amusement and laughter through being extremely funny or entertaining
examples: The comedian's hilarious jokes had everyone laughing uncontrollably
We watched a hilarious movie that brightened our mood

definitions: having many hills or characterized by slopes and elevated terrain
examples: San Francisco is famous for its hilly streets
The hilly countryside made farming quite challenging

definitions: situated at or toward the rear or back part of something
examples: The dog stood on its hind legs to reach the treat
The horse's hind quarters were exceptionally strong

definitions: creating difficulties that result in delay or prevent progress
examples: The heavy rain was hindering construction work
His negative attitude was hindering team productivity

definitions: employed or engaged for payment to perform work or services
examples: The hired workers arrived early to start the project
She drove a hired car during her vacation

definitions: sounding rough and harsh, typically from shouting or illness
examples: His voice was hoarse after cheering at the game
She spoke in hoarse whispers due to laryngitis

definitions: gray or white with age, especially of hair or fur
old and trite from overuse; ancient and no longer interesting
examples: The mountain peaks were hoary with frost and snow
His hoary beard gave him a distinguished appearance
The professor repeated the same hoary jokes every semester
That hoary old myth has been debunked many times

definitions: noticeably contrived, artificial, or overly sentimental in an unconvincing way
examples: The movie's hokey dialogue made audiences groan
His hokey attempts at romance seemed insincere

definitions: characterized by treating the whole person or situation rather than just symptoms
examples: The doctor takes a holistic approach to patient care
Their holistic education program develops mind, body, and spirit

definitions: having a hole or empty space inside; not solid
without significance or sincerity; meaningless or false
examples: The old tree trunk was completely hollow inside
Children love playing with hollow chocolate eggs
His hollow promises meant nothing after so many betrayals
The victory felt hollow without her there to share it

definitions: relating to or produced by holograms that create three-dimensional images
examples: The museum featured holographic displays of historical figures
Credit cards often include holographic security features

definitions: grown or produced in one's own garden, locality, or country
developed from within a group or organization rather than brought from outside
examples: The restaurant serves only homegrown vegetables
She preferred homegrown tomatoes to store-bought ones
The company promoted homegrown talent over external hires
Their homegrown software solution worked better than commercial alternatives

definitions: unattractive in appearance; lacking beauty or elegance
simple and unpretentious; having a comfortable, familiar quality like home
examples: Despite her homely features, her personality was captivating
The homely duckling transformed into a beautiful swan
The cottage had a homely charm that made guests feel welcome
She preferred homely meals to fancy restaurant food

definitions: made at home rather than in a store or factory
examples: Nothing beats the taste of homemade bread
She brought homemade cookies to the office party

definitions: relating to treatment of disease by minute doses of natural substances
examples: She tried homeopathic remedies before turning to conventional medicine
The homeopathic clinic offered natural treatment alternatives

definitions: experiencing a longing for one's home during absence from it
examples: The exchange student felt homesick during her first month abroad
Homesick soldiers counted days until their return

definitions: made of yarn spun at home; woven in a simple way
simple and unsophisticated in character; having plain, folksy qualities
examples: She wore a dress made from homespun fabric
The quilt featured traditional homespun patterns
His homespun wisdom came from years of experience
The politician's homespun manner appealed to rural voters

definitions: going toward home or directed toward one's home
examples: The tired travelers began their homeward journey
Birds flew homeward as sunset approached

definitions: having or showing a tendency to commit murder
examples: The detective investigated the suspect's homicidal threats
His homicidal rage terrified everyone in the room

definitions: relating to the ability to return to a specific location
examples: Homing pigeons can find their way back over great distances
The missile used homing technology to reach its target

definitions: relating to the primate family that includes humans and their ancestors
examples: Scientists discovered ancient hominid fossils in Africa
The museum displayed hominid evolution through skeletal remains

definitions: concerning or arousing sexual desire centered on the same sex
examples: Art historians noted homoerotic themes in Renaissance paintings
The novel contained subtle homoerotic undertones

definitions: of the same kind throughout; consisting of parts all of similar nature
examples: The solution became homogeneous after thorough mixing
The neighborhood had a homogeneous population with similar incomes

definitions: uniform in structure or composition throughout; of the same kind
examples: The cream formed a homogenous mixture when properly blended
Their homogenous culture reflected centuries of isolation

definitions: having or showing dislike or prejudice against homosexual people
examples: The company fired employees who made homophobic comments
Schools implemented policies to prevent homophobic bullying

definitions: sexually attracted to people of one's own sex rather than opposite sex
examples: The country legalized homosexual marriage last year
Support groups help homosexual teens facing discrimination

definitions: deserving honor and respect for having high moral standards
bringing or showing honor and adherence to ethical principles
examples: The judge had an honorable reputation for fairness
Veterans received honorable discharge from military service
His honorable conduct during the crisis earned widespread admiration
She made the honorable decision to return the money

definitions: conferred as an honor without usual requirements or functions
examples: The university awarded her an honorary doctorate degree
He served as honorary chairman of the charity

definitions: regarded with great respect and admiration; given special recognition
examples: The honored guest gave the keynote speech
She felt honored to receive such a prestigious award

definitions: given as a mark of respect but having few duties
examples: The committee granted him an honorific title
Japanese language uses many honorific expressions

definitions: bringing or worthy of honor through having high moral standards
showing honesty and integrity in one's actions and intentions
examples: The honourable gentleman always kept his word
She chose the honourable path despite personal cost
His honourable behavior set an example for others
The company maintained honourable business practices

definitions: curved or bent like a hook in shape
unable to stop using or doing something; strongly addicted or devoted
examples: The eagle's hooked beak tore into its prey
He caught the fish with a hooked piece of wire
She became hooked on mystery novels last summer
Many people get hooked on social media

definitions: feeling or inspiring optimism about a future event or situation
examples: She remained hopeful despite the challenging circumstances
The team felt hopeful about winning the championship

definitions: feeling or causing despair about something; lacking any hope
showing no skill or ability; inadequate or incompetent at something
examples: The situation seemed hopeless with no solution in sight
He felt hopeless after losing his job
She's hopeless at cooking even simple meals
I'm completely hopeless with technology
